thread.title: Ideas for a California Vacation in September
thread.title_full: Ideas for a California Vacation in September

title: Ideas for a California Vacation in September
text:
Ideas for a California Vacation in September California Travel Notebook: September 2015 Sign Up for our Free Newsletters Thanks, You're in! Health Tip of the Day Sign up There was an error. Please try again. Please select a newsletter. Please enter a valid email address. Did you mean ? Expert Videos 
If you're planning a trip to California this September - or if you're a California resident who wants to visit another part of the Golden State after the summer vacation crowds go home - I'm opening my travel writer's notebook to show you what's inside. 
Here's a roundup of all kinds of things to do, things we like and fun events happening in California this September. Busy Day on Stinson Beach. ©2014 Betsy Malloy Photography. Used by Permission. • September's Big Holiday: Labor Day 
I just love that summer begins and ends with a three-day holiday weekend. Always observed on the first Monday in September, Labor Day is dedicated to the social and economic achievements of workers. That makes it a good time to take the day off from all that work to relax and play with friends and family. 
To get some ideas about what you can do over the long weekend, check out the guide to Labor Day Fun in California . Savor California. ©2013 Betsy Malloy Photography. Used by Permission. • The Best Things We Can Think of to Do in September 
These are a few of the most enjoyable and popular things that you can do in California this September: 
The Los Angeles County Fair runs through most of the month of September. It's one of the state's biggest and most elaborate county fairs, held in Pomona. 
The Monterey Jazz Festival kicks off mid-month, with an always-outstanding lineup of great musicians. It's almost always a sellout, making it a good idea to buy tickets at least two weeks in advance. 
My favorite California culinary event, SAVOR the Central Coast heats up in Paso Robles, Santa Margarita and other parts of San Luis Obispo County. 
California lobsters are called "Spiny" - you'll know why when you see one. They have smaller claws than their Atlantic coast cousins, but many Californians love them just the same. Lobster-catching season starts near the end of September and you'll find meals featuring them on menus in their southern California range, which extends from San Diego up to San Luis Obispo. Autumn Moon Festival Lantern Parade. David McSpadden/Flickr/CC BY 2. • California in September 
These guides include things we've done and we think you'd like them, too - and a collection of things that look like fun to try. Disneyland in September : This is a good time to visit Disneyland, between holidays while the days are still long enough and temperatures cool down Los Angeles in September : Food, fairs and tall ships are fun to enjoy - and the summer concert schedule continues through the month San Diego in September : Fleet Week is the big September event in San Diego, but you can also enjoy the tall ships here - or go to a summer's end concert San Francisco in September : September is one of San Fran's nicest months - and it's one of the best months for fun festivals including the Fringe Festival, Autumn Moon Festival, Dragon Boat Festival and Folsom Street Fair
